meanings.definition: To guard or watch over as a sentinel.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight sentineled the castle all night.
meanings.sent2: The security guard sentineled the entrance to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant squirrel sentineled the nut stash from other animals.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse sentineled the rocky coast, guiding ships to safety.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog sentineled the house, barking at any approaching strangers.

meanings.sent1: The sentineled tower stood tall against the enemy attacks.
meanings.sent2: The sentineled border was well-protected by the vigilant soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The sentineled forest was a peaceful sanctuary for the wildlife.
meanings.sent4: The sentineled fortress was an impenetrable stronghold.
meanings.sent5: The sentineled city gates were always closed at night for security.
